tech_news.title: Dell is eating humble pie and bringing back the XPS brand - The Verge
tech_news.description: Dell is bringing back its XPS laptops after initially killing off the brand at last year’s CES. The new XPS 14 and XPS 16 are Dell’s thinnest models yet, with an even thinner XPS 13 teased.

tech_news.title: What on Earth is HP doing with its gaming laptop branding? - The Verge
tech_news.description: HP is announcing at CES 2026 that all its laptops, desktops, and monitors are being rebranded from HP Omen to HyperX Omen. Why, though?

tech_news.title: Lego Smart Bricks Light Up With Jedi Magic In Coming Star Wars Set – and I'm Obsessed - CNET
tech_news.description: The brand-new, jaw-dropping Lego smart brick tech can recognize other bricks, activate effects and play music. They're debuting in Star Wars Lego sets this spring and we got an early look at CES 2026.

tech_news.title: MacBook Pro revamp this year has me excited, but one change won’t be for everyone - 9to5Mac
tech_news.description: The MacBook Pro is rumored to get a major redesign this year with significant feature upgrades too. But one change may not be for everyone.

tech_news.title: Samsung’s new phone looks straight out of science fiction. I got to try it - CNN
tech_news.description: With its new Galaxy Z TriFold, Samsung is betting it can wow consumers with an iPad-sized screen that folds up like a brochure to fit neatly in your pocket.

tech_news.title: How Andrew Huberman, Goop Kitchen Collaborator, Is Staying Healthy in 2026 - GQ
tech_news.description: The host of the hit Huberman Lab podcast is monitoring his light levels, tracking his micronutrients, and drinking in moderation this year.
